text: the Lions killed with a male on the left
two cubs next to him and the mother
walking behind they were destroyed to
make way for a new three-year-old male
arrival despite appeals to other zoos no
homes could be found for the Cubs last
month this two-year-old giraffe Marius
was fed to the Lions after being
destroyed because he was surplus to the
requirements of the zoo's breeding
program despite worldwide outrage ever--
Marius is death the zoo has not changed
its policy which sees it cull about 30
animals a year it would be unethical if
we braid our animals in a way and let
only our feelings George no no decide
what to do with the animals instead of
put it on scientific basis because if we
don't ensure healthy population for the
future we would do a bad job and that's
not fair in a statement officials said
the change in the pride had to happen
because the zoo had two young females
from the 2012 litter and it was ideal to
keep them as part of the new pride and
then find a suitable male if it had not
made the change the zoo would have
risked that the old male would mate with
these two females his own offspring and
thereby give rise to inbreeding animal
welfare groups which protested outside
the zoo after Marius his death have
described as immoral the culling of the
Lions one organization said the zoo was
playing at God and should be boycotted
until it started respecting animals the
only consolation as far as the
protesters are concerned is that the
Lions carcasses were not dissected in
public but are being used for scientific
experiments malcolm brabant BBC News
Copenhagen
